Fact.Name: Form 1099-R
Fact.Description: Form 1099-R: Distributions From Pensions, Annuities, Retirement or Profit-Sharing Plans, IRAs, Insurance Contracts, etc.

Fact.Name: Has 1099-R
Fact.Description: Whether the TP has any 1099-R listed
Whether the TP claimed to have 1099-R forms in the TY. Note that this is used when the 1099R feature flag is turned off
Whether the TP claimed to have 1099Rs and the 1099R feature is disabled

Fact.Name: 1099-R Feature Flag
Fact.Description: Fact for enabling the 1099-R feature flag. Controlled by build configuration.

Fact.Name: Recipient
Fact.Description: The recipient of the 1099-R.
Whether the 1099-R belongs to the primary filer
Whether the 1099-R belongs to the secondary filer
Whether the secondary filer is used without MFJ
Whether there are any form 1099Rs that use the secondary filer when the status is not MFJ

Fact.Name: Recipient 1099-R address choice options
Fact.Description: If the recipient's address matches the return, if it's different, or there is none.

Fact.Name: 1099-R recipient address
Fact.Description: Same as return, is different, or none

Fact.Name: Address on form is same as tax return
Fact.Description: Whether the form contains the same recipient address as the tax return.
Whether the form has a recipient address different than the tax return
Recipient's address, if it doesn't match the one on the return
Whether the recipient has an address on the 1099R

Fact.Name: Recipient's address
Fact.Description: The recipient's address and ZIP code override field.
The recipient's zipcode with any non-digit characters (like -) stripped out.
The payer of the 1099-R.
Line 2 of the payer's name on the 1099-R

Whether the 1099R has a distribution that Direct file does not support yet. Note: if you change this fact, review that the newly supported codes are correctly included in facts like ../hasDistributionCodeIncludedInSaversCredit and ../isFullyOrPartlyTaxablePension
Whether this 1099R has a rollover distribution code.
Forms 1099-R with pension rollover
Whether this 1099R has a rollover distribution code.
Forms 1099-R with direct rollover
Whether any 1099R has a rollover distribution code.
Used in the flow to determine whether to show 1099-r-box-7-indirect-rollover

Fact.Name: 1099-R Total Rollover Distribution Knockout
Fact.Description: The filer is knocked out of scope if they rolled their distribution into another retirement account
Whether the user is knocked out for their 1099R distribution rolled into another retirement account
Forms 1099-R with unsupported distribution codes
Whether the user is knocked out for their 1099R distribution code (box 7)

At least one 1099-R has a direct rollover pre-to-pre-tax (ie non-ROTH) account or direct rollover after-to-after tax (ie ROTH) account. Any changes to this KO should check that ../primaryFiler1099RsReportedOnSaversCredit and ../secondaryFiler1099RsReportedOnSaversCredit are still calculated correctly.
Flow knockout for when the user is knocked out for having direct rollover pre-to-pre-tax (ie non-ROTH) account or direct rollover after-to-after tax (ie ROTH) account
The payer's Tin from the 1099-R.
Box 1 of form 1099-R: Gross Distribution
Whether the payer has an address
The payer's address from the 1099-R.
The payer's zipcode with any non-digit characters (like -) stripped out.
The payer's phone from the 1099-R.
Box 1 of form 1099-R: Gross Distribution (rounded)
Box 2a of form 1099-R: Taxable Amount
Box 2a of form 1099-R: Taxable Amount (rounded)

Fact.Name: Primary Filer 1099Rs
Fact.Description: The 1099Rs that belong to the primary filer

Fact.Name: Secondary Filer 1099Rs
Fact.Description: The 1099Rs that belong to the secondary filer

Fact.Name: Primary filer 1099R
Fact.Description: Amount of 1099R taxable amount for primary filer

The primary filer's 1099Rs that meet the criteria to be reported on the form 8880 line 4a. Note if 1099R scope changes this filtered fact should be audited against the 8880 instructions so that it still includes all of the supported distribution types specified in the instructions.

Fact.Name: Primary filer has 1099R taxable amounts greater than 0
Fact.Description: Whether primary filer has taxable amounts greater than 0

Fact.Name: Secondary filer has 1099R taxable amounts greater than 0
Fact.Description: Whether secondary filer has taxable amounts greater than 0

Fact.Name: Secondary filer 1099R
Fact.Description: Amount of 1099R taxable amount for primary filer

The secondary filer's 1099Rs that meet the criteria to be reported on the form 8880 line 4b. Note if 1099R scope changes this filtered fact should be audited against the 8880 instructions so that it still includes all of the supported distribution types specified in the instructions.
Whether the taxable amount is not determined and 2b is checked.
Whether the taxable amount is not determined and 2b is checked.

Fact.Name: Knockout Due to the taxable amount of the distribution being undetermined
Fact.Description: At least one 1099R has a set of facts that cause a knockout

Fact.Name: 1099-R Total Distribution Knockout
Fact.Description: The filer is knocked out of scope if they got taxable amount in box 2a blank and taxableAmountNotDetermined not checked

Fact.Name: Knockout Due to the taxable amount not determined unchecked and taxable amount in box 2a being blank
Fact.Description: At least one 1099R has a set of facts that cause a knockout
Box 3 of form 1099-R: Capital Gain

Fact.Name: Retirement captial gain
Fact.Description: Box 3 of Form 1099-R, capital gain from box 2a.

Fact.Name: Knockout Due to Retirement Capital Gain
Fact.Description: At least one 1099R has a set of facts that cause a knockout

Fact.Name: 1099-R Capital Gain Scope Knockout
Fact.Description: Capital gain info in this 1099-R knocks the filer out of scope.
Whether the IRA/SEP/SIMPLE box is checked.
If total distribution is checked, it's a total distribution that closed out the account.
Whether the taxable amount is not determined and 2b is checked.
Whether the recipient was born before 1936.

Fact.Name: 1099-R Total Distribution Knockout
Fact.Description: The filer is knocked out of scope if they got a total distrubution and were born before 1/2/1936

Fact.Name: Knockout Due to a TP receiving a total distribution and born before 1/2/1936
Fact.Description: At least one 1099R has a set of facts that cause a knockout
Box 7 of form 1099-R: Distribution Code(s)
Box 7 of form 1099-R: Distribution Code(s)
Whether this form is not for an IRA and Box 7 contains only the Distribution Code for Disability
Whether this form is not for an IRA and Box 7 contains the Distribution Code for Disability along with another code
Whether this form is not for an IRA and is for a tax free pension rollover
Whether this form is not for an IRA but is for a taxable pension rollover
Whether this form should be treated as an indirect rollover
Whether this form should be treated as taxable amount not determined
Whether this form should be treated as not IRA/SEP/SIMPLE
User response: is this form for an indirect rollover
User response: is this distribution from a military retirement plan
User response: is this form for an indirect rollover after accounting for edit conditions

At least one 1099R causes a knockout due to IRA/SEP/SIMPLE. Any changes to this KO should check that ../primaryFiler1099RsReportedOnSaversCredit and ../secondaryFiler1099RsReportedOnSaversCredit are still calculated correctly
At least one 1099R causes a knockout due to disability plus another distribution code
At least one 1099R causes a knockout due to taxable pension rollover
At least one 1099R causes a knockout due to indirect rollover
At least one 1099R causes a knockout due to taxable amount not determined
Whether this form is a rollover

Whether this form is for a fully or partly taxable pension. This currently corresponds directly to the codes included in Savers credit calculations, but if more box 7 codes are added this should be reviewed.
The 1099R has a distribution code that is included in the sum for the Savers Credit (Form 8880) line 4
Whether this form is for a partly taxable pension
Primary Filer's Forms 1099-R with only the distribution code for disability
Secondary Filer's Forms 1099-R with only the distribution code for disability
Forms 1099-R with tax free pension rollover

Forms 1099-R with fully taxable pension

The sum of gross distributions for this collection of forms

The sum of gross distributions for this collection of forms
The sum of gross distributions for this collection of forms
The sum of taxable amounts for this collection of forms

Box 8 of Form 1099-R, other amount.

Fact.Description: Box 8 value entry info in this 1099-R knocks the filer out of scope.

Fact.Description: At least one 1099R has a set of facts that cause a knockout

Fact.Description: Box 8 percentage entry info in this 1099-R knocks the filer out of scope

Fact.Description: Percentage total distribution
Box 9a percentage entry info in this 1099-R knocks the filer out of scope

Fact.Description: At least one 1099R has a set of facts that cause a knockout

Fact.Name: Total employee contributions
Fact.Description: Box 9b of form 1099-R: Total employee contributions
Box 9b of form 1099-R: Total employee contributions

Fact.Name: Amount allocable to IRR within 5 years
Fact.Description: Box 10 of form 1099-R: Amount allocable to IRR within 5 years
Box 10 of form 1099-R: Amount allocable to IRR within 5 years

Fact.Name: 1099-R Amount allocable to IRR within 5 years Knockout
Fact.Description: The filer is knocked out of scope if amount allocable to IRR within 5 years is greater than zero.

Fact.Name: Knockout due to the amount allocable to IRR within 5 years
Fact.Description: The filer is knocked out of scope if amount allocable to IRR within 5 years is greater than zero

Fact.Name: 1st year of designated Roth contributions
Fact.Description: Box 11 of form 1099-R: 1st year of designated Roth contributions
Whether the 1099R has any local or state tax info
Whether the 1099R has any local tax info
Box 14 of form 1099-R: State tax withheld

Fact.Name: Federal income tax withheld
Fact.Description: Box 14 of Form 1099-R: Federal income tax withheld (rounded).
Whether the TP is in an income state and didn't report any state tax on their 1099R
Whether any 1099Rs had less gross distributions reported than the amount of tax withheld. Used for alerts and to block submission
The gross distributions reported were less than the local and state tax withheld. This isn't a real situation and indicates an input error

Fact.Name: State abbreviation code
Fact.Description: Box 15 of form 1099-R: payer's state

Fact.Name: State Code (xml)
Fact.Description: The state code used to populate the element corresponding to form 1099-R box 15. This fact is used to handle mapping the values used by the DF client into what the MeF system and DF submit application expect.

Fact.Name: Payers state I.D. number
Fact.Description: Box 15 of form 1099-R: payer's state code

Fact.Name: Causes Box 15 Knockout
Fact.Description: If a taxpayer's state on their 1099-R doesn't match the state in their About You section, we may not be able to give the right information for State tax filing. Knocks taxpayer out if all of the following are true: 1. User selects "Another state" from the dropdown; 2. Box 14 is has a value greater than $0 (or blank); box 7 does not include distribution code G or H.

Fact.Name: Knockout when state on 1099-R doesn't match filer's state of residency
Fact.Description: At least one 1099R has a set of facts that cause a knockout
Box 16 of form 1099-R: State distribution

Fact.Name: State distribution
Fact.Description: Box 16 of Form 1099-R: State distribution (rounded).
Box 17 of form 1099-R: Local tax withheld

Fact.Name: Federal income tax withheld
Fact.Description: Box 17 of form 1099-R: Local tax withheld (rounded).

Fact.Name: Locality name
Fact.Description: Form 1099-R box 18: Locality name. This is the writable optional fact. Can be left incomplete. Please use the derived fact in downstream calculations.
Box 19 of form 1099-R: Local distribution

Fact.Name: Local distribution
Fact.Description: Box 19 of form 1099-R: Local distribution (rounded).

Fact.Name: Knockout when FACTA filing requirement box is checked
Fact.Description: At least one 1099R has a set of facts that cause a knockout
